abstract.p: IBM researchers develop a complete version of Linux operating system that runs on a prototype computer only 2.2 inches by 1.89 inches by 0.48 inch (S)

block.p: Pushing beyond its server computer roots, the free Linux operating system has found its way into the smallest computer yet: a machine the size of a matchbox. I.B.M. researchers plan to announce that they have developed a complete version of the Linux software that runs on a prototype computer only 2.2 inches by 1.89 inches by 0.48 inch. The computer, which the researchers said could be worn like a watch, has a central processor, eight megabytes of nonvolatile memory and another eight megabytes of dynamic random access memory. The new I.B.M. machine is slightly smaller than a similar commercial computer already made by Tiqit Computers in Palo Alto, Calif.
